title: rustc does not panic when it fails to allocate memory
body:

I tried this code:

```rust
fn a(k : i32, m : i32, n : i32)->i32 {
  if (k == 1) {
    return m + n
  } else {
    if (n == 1) {
      return m;
    } else {
      return a(k - 1, m, a(k, m, n - 1));
    }
  }
}

  ($n : expr) => { a($n, $n, $n); }
}
```

I expected to see this happen: I expected it to compile and run just fine.

Instead, this happened: 
```
memory allocation of 59768848 bytes failed

Compiler returned: 255
```
